channel.title: AP News - US News
channel.description: Top US News stories from AP News

item.title: Apologetic rapper Tekashi 6ix9ine gets 45 days in prison for probation violations
item.description: Apologetic rapper Tekashi 6ix9ine has been sentenced to 45 days in prison after repeatedly violating probation, disappointing a federal judge who rewarded his cooperation in a criminal case against him with leniency five years ago.

item.title: Georgia House Republicans stick with leadership team for the next two years
item.description: Georgia House Republicans will keep their leadership team for the next two years. They gathered Tuesday inside the state Capitol and renominated Jon Burns of Newington as speaker, a position that is traditionally the second-most influential post in state government behind the governor.

item.title: 12 college students charged with hate crimes after assault in Maryland
item.description: A dozen students at Salisbury University on Marylandâ€™s Eastern Shore have been charged with hate crimes after police say they assaulted a gay man.
